word:
Abridged

11 - Do All I Can

Date: July 21, 1904 Location: Washington, D.C. Source: Letter, 265, 1904 Status: Previously unpublished
Context: Mrs. White frequently corresponds with her son and daughter-inlaw on how the work in the South should be carried out.
Dear children Edson and Emma,
     I am not very strong, but will write you a few lines. I hope that I shall soon feel better and will be able to add to what I can now write.
